wikipedia_page.main: Margaret Betty Harvie Anderson, Baroness Skrimshire of Quarter,  (12 August 1913 – 7 November 1979) was a British Conservative Party politician. She was the first woman to become a Deputy Speaker of the House of Commons, which she served as from 1970 to 1973.
